TITLE: Investors all face the same four hurdles right now, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: There are four main hurdles all investors have to traverse right now, but anyone who does so effectively will see a payoff, Jim Cramer said on Tuesday.

TITLE: This earnings season has been 'pretty darn good' and several companies stand out, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: After getting earnings from two-thirds of Dow Industrials, it shouldn't come as a surprise that the market is so high, Jim Cramer said.

TITLE: Consumer goods stocks are set to keep running, and it's not too late to buy, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: Food and consumer goods stocks are poised to keep running, Jim Cramer said Friday, at least if no external news drags down the entire market.

TITLE: Thursday's rally showed the power of stock picking, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: "Index fund 'evangelistas'" likely wouldn't have urged you to take any of the big winners, Cramer said.

TITLE: First Republic’s 'miserable moment' is different from the 2008 contagion, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: First Republic’s dismal earnings report won’t trigger the chain reaction that investors fear, Jim Cramer said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Investors should embrace the Jerry Jones playbook and think long term as earnings heat up, Cramer says
SUMMARY: CNBC's Jim Cramer says investors should consider Alphabet and Microsoft for their long-term desirability, rather than their immediate value.

TITLE: A week of earnings and economic data mean a 'wholesale reshuffling' for stocks, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: Economic data and a bevy of earnings releases mean the next two weeks are critical for investors to pay attention to, Jim Cramer said.

TITLE: Strong individual performers can buoy whole sectors, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: Outperformance in traditionally weaker sectors is a keen reminder to get in before market commentators catch on.

TITLE: Investors who do their homework can find good opportunities in a skittish market, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: Three companies that saw trading swing on earnings this week were opportunities for investors to look past early bias and buy in.

TITLE: Investors shouldn't be 'shadowboxing' with recession fears, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: Listening to commentators who constantly wonder about when recession will come means investors miss out on potential upside amidst a quiet bull market.

TITLE: More than 200 companies want to apply for CHIPS Act funding, Commerce Secretary Raimondo tells Cramer
SUMMARY: The applicants come from varied industries, but must abide by a key principle: taking U.S. money means committing to only investing in U.S. expansion.

TITLE: Here are the stocks Jim Cramer thinks are the 'greatest moves of our era'
SUMMARY: Avoiding fear and leaning into the fundamentals of a company allows investors to capitalize on opportunity before other players catch on.

TITLE: The Fed's efforts to fight housing inflation by hiking interest rates has backfired, Cramer says
SUMMARY: Rate hikes have done nothing to stem increasing housing prices, and in fact may have made things worse, Cramer said.

TITLE: The Fed needs two industries to suffer in order to beat inflation, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: It’s going to be tough for the Federal Reserve to beat inflation without getting the auto and housing industries in check, CNBC’s Jim Cramer said on Tuesday.

TITLE: A frozen IPO market signals two positive things for stocks, CNBC's Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: "The incumbents are winning, and that means their earnings could be better than anyone thinks," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

TITLE: Strong management can help companies 'change their stripes,' Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: Look at a company like Costco, which successfully responds to changing consumer demand month-by-month.

TITLE: Look to 3 'great American companies' in this market, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: There are three companies that Cramer thinks have compelling stories and strength: Johnson & Johnson, Eli Lilly, and Procter & Gamble.

TITLE: The spiraling banking crisis is leaving traders divided, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: The spiraling banking crisis has prompted concerns about liquidity, credit, and defaults, leaving traders split into camps that Cramer is "dismissive of."

TITLE: Here's how Jim Cramer thinks the banking crisis will impact the consumer
SUMMARY: The unraveling of the regional banking sector and successive bank failures will cause pain for the consumer in three key areas, CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

TITLE: A post-Covid spending hangover means you have to be more selective with pet plays, Cramer says
SUMMARY: Consumer-spending trends popular during the pandemic have shifted. That means it's a hit or miss when it comes to pet stocks, CNBC's Jim Cramer said Friday.

TITLE: A recession may be coming, but Jim Cramer says he's not seeing the early signs yet
SUMMARY: Unless you've been laid off by a tech company, or you work at Party City or Bed Bath & Beyond, "you're probably doing pretty darn well right now," Cramer said.

TITLE: Fed's role in SVB failure became a positive for stocks, Cramer says
SUMMARY: Thanks to the Federal Reserve, the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank has ended up breaking positive for the stock market, Jim Cramer says

TITLE: Rallies from Walgreens, PVH and McCormick could be a good sign for earnings season, Cramer says
SUMMARY: Stocks that rallied Tuesday in response to "less than stellar" quarterly reports could bode well for earnings season, CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

TITLE: First Citizens takeover of SVB won't solve the bank run problem, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: Cramer said the Fed will continue with rate hikes until wage inflation cools off, but that if another large bank like First Republic collapses, "it'll definitely do the job."

TITLE: The market's initial reaction to a Fed rate hike is 'almost always a head fake,' Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: CNBC's Jim Cramer said Friday that the initial market sell-off prompted by the Fed rate hike may point to a reversal in the coming months, based on past data.

TITLE: Yellen's comments rattled the market, not the Fed rate hike, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve's quarter-point rate hike "seems just right," said CNBC's Jim Cramer.

TITLE: Jim Cramer says investors need to take a 'longer view' to survive this volatile market
SUMMARY: "Anyone who thinks they know what’s gonna happen in the next hour or two is wrong," CNBC's Jim Cramer said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Jim Cramer says the banking crisis is fighting inflation for Powell and the Fed
SUMMARY: CNBC's Jim Cramer on Thursday said the banking crisis is fighting inflation and the Fed no longer needs to take action.

TITLE: As bank crisis spreads, Cramer says the Fed may need to take drastic measures
SUMMARY: CNBC's Jim Cramer on Wednesday said the Federal Reserve may need to take drastic measures, which could be "fantastic" for your portfolio.

TITLE: Jim Cramer says the Fed is on the cusp of a 'soft, safe landing' in its inflation fight
SUMMARY: "I now believe it would be reckless if Powell goes much beyond 5%," Cramer said.
